title: New Doctor Who - 2013 50th Anniversary Celebration - 18 Specials
description:
New Doctor Who
                         2013 50th Anniversary Celebration
                                    18 Specials


After all of the series 7 episodes and specials were collected and published, the following specials were left. They make up the 2013 50th Anniversary Celebration of Doctor Who. Presented for your enjoyment, 18 Specials ranging from BBC America's 'Doctors Revisited' series, to the 'Day of the Doctor After Party.'

Note: The Specials, 'The Science of Doctor Who' and 'The Ultimate Guide' are titles that have been used before and because of that, I have added the number '2' to the name it note the newer versions of the show.


The Doctor Revisited Series Description Courtesy Of:

TARDIS Data Core <a href="
http://tardis.wikia.com/wiki/The_Doctors_Revisited" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://tardis.wikia.com/wiki/The_Doctors_Revisited</a>


The Doctors Revisited was a series of documentaries produced and broadcast by BBC America to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Doctor Who. One documentary was broadcast every month, each focusing on a different incarnation of the Doctor. The series began in January with a First Doctor documentary and proceeded chronologically through the Doctors until it culminated with an Eleventh Doctor documentary in November. Each documentary was then followed up by a broadcast of a story featuring that Doctor, edited into an omnibus format (save the Eighth, the only doctor to have a single-parter from his era shown). All stories shown in the classic era prior to the 2005 revival have made their BBC America debut. 


The Doctor Revisited Episode Descriptions Courtesy Of:

Internet Movie Database (IMDB, <a href="
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2795780/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2795780/</a>

and

The Television Database
An Open Database for Television Fans <a href="
http://www.thetvdb.com" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.thetvdb.com</a>


2013-01-27 - The Doctors Revisited - The 1st Doctor, William Hartnell (Video:H264 1920x1080, 1963kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 95kbps)

The First Doctor introduced viewers to an incredible show that is still popular 50 years later. Ã¢â‚¬ËœThe Doctors RevisitedÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ looks in detail at this citizen of the universe to find out what makes this Doctor so unique. We take a look at his time machine the TARDIS, meet his companions and finally confront his most famous foes, the Daleks.


2013-02-24 - The Doctors Revisited - The 2nd Doctor, Patrick Troughton (Video:H264 512x288, 1470bps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 95kbps)

The Second Doctor brought a new energy to the series. With his impish charm and boundless enthusiasm, the show began to evolve and change. Join Ã¢â‚¬ËœThe Doctors RevisitedÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ as we take a look at this new approach to the character, meet his fearless Scottish highlander companion Jamie McCrimmon and take a close look at one of the most iconic of his foes, the emotionless Cybermen!


2013-03-31 - The Doctors Revisited - The 3rd Doctor, Jon Pertwee (Video:H264 1920x1080, 1973kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 95kbps)

A new decade, a new Doctor. And now in color! The Revisited team takes a nostalgic look back at the adventures of the third Doctor, played by Jon Pertwee, his role as scientific adviser to U.N.I.T., and the first appearance of the Master. Hugh Bonneville joins the regular contributors.


2013-04-28 - The Doctors Revisited - The 4th Doctor, Tom Baker (Video:H264 1920x1074, 1976kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 101kbps)

The Revisited team looks back to the era of the fourth, and longest serving, Doctor, played by Tom Baker, who brought a new and eccentric take on the Time Lord. Highlights include the first visit to the Doctor's home world, Gallifrey, and the introduction of Davros, the creator of the Daleks. Show star Tom Baker and companion Louise Jameson join the regular contributors.


2013-05-26 - The Doctors Revisited  The 5th Doctor, Peter Davidson (Video:H264 1280x720, 1978kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 96kbps)

Take an in-depth look at the fifth incarnation of the timeless Time Lord, played by the youngest actor in the part until current Matt Smith.


2013-06-29 - The Doctors Revisited - The 6th Doctor, Colin Baker (Video:H264 1280x720, 1982kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 96kbps)

Take a look back at the sixth and most eccentric incarnation of the Doctor yet! As the Sixth Doctor, played by Colin Baker, generated onto our screens in a patchwork blast of color, he brought with him his own sense of style and character. 


2013-07-27 - The Doctors Revisited - The 7th Doctor, Sylvester McCoy (Video:H264 1280x716, 1982kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 96kbps)

Discover the many layers of Sylvester McCoy's Seventh Doctor.


2013-08-31 - The Doctors Revisited - The 8th Doctor, Paul McGann (Video:H264 1280x718, 1983kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 104kbps)

The Eighth Doctor was vibrantly played by Paul McGann and this episode of The Doctors Revisited looks at the impression he made to the Doctor Who legend. With contributions from companions Daphne Ashbrook and Yee Jee Tso and current show-runner Steven Moffat, we take a detailed look at what made this Doctor so unique. 


2013-09-29 - The Doctors Revisited - The 9th Doctor, Christopher Eccleston (Video:H264 1280x720, 1977kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 96kbps)

Christopher Eccleston, the Ninth Doctor, heralded the return of the Doctor and brought him up to date with the 21st Century. Lead writer and executive producer Steven Moffat, writer Neil Gaiman, John Barrowman (Captain Jack Harkness), and actor Noel Clarke (Mickey Smith) discuss Eccleston portraying a no nonsense, hard hitting and straight talking Doctor. 


2013-10-27 - The Doctors Revisited The 10th Doctor, David Tennant (Video:H264 1280x720, 1982kbps, 30fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 95kbps)

As a dashing young man in a pin-stripe suit, the Tenth Doctor, played by David Tennant, was the thousand year-old alien you could bring home to meet your Mom. But never get on his bad side - there were no second chances with this Doctor. Featuring an all star interview list - including - David Tennant, Freema Agyeman, David Morrisey, Camille Coduri, Neil Gaiman, Peter Davison and many more.


2013-11-24 - The Doctors Revisited - The 11th Doctor, Matt Smith (Video:H264 720x480, 1946kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 96kbps)

The Eleventh Doctor, played by Matt Smith, arrived on screen lively, funny but wise. Join the Doctors Revisited as we examine the human side of this Doctor and take a look at how his 950 years have affected him. Featuring interviews with Matt Smith and Jenna Coleman, we take a look at the Doctor's new companion Clara Oswald and catch a glimpse of the Doctor's very frightening foe The Silence. 


Additional Specials (2013)


2013-08-26 - Special - Doctor Who at the Proms 2013 (Video:H264 1280x720, 1969kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 102kbps)

The concert features the very best of Murray GoldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s scores for recent adventures as well as music from the eras of the early Doctors. Matt Smith and Jenna Coleman make special appearances and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s great to see Madam Vastra and Strax back, hosting the Prom. In fact, any concert without a Sontaran and a Silurian will now seem relatively pedestrian! And watch out for some very special surprise guests who help make this an unforgettable celebration of the music of Doctor Who.


2013-11-14 - Special - The Science of Doctor Who 2 (Video:H264 720x404, 1476kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 99kbps)

For one night only, Professor Brian Cox takes an audience of celebrity guests, including Charles Dance and Rufus Hound, and members of the public on a journey into the wonderful universe of the Doctor, from the lecture hall of the Royal Institution of Great Britain. Drawing on the latest theories as well as 200 years of scientific discoveries and the genius of Einstein, Brian tries to answer the classic questions raised by the Doctor - can you really travel in time? Does extra-terrestrial life exist in our galaxy? And how do you build something as fantastical as the TARDIS?


2013-11-18 - Special - The Ultimate Guide 2 (Video:H264 720x404, 1472kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 108kbps)

Matt Smith and Jenna Coleman celebrate the 50th anniversary of the space-traveling Time Lord and take an in-depth look at of one of the most intriguing fictional characters of all time. With the 50th anniversary episode, The Day of the Doctor, about to hit our screens there's a look at all 11 incarnations of the Doctor and their most famous scenes and story-lines, an exploration of the many sides to the Doctor and asking what is he really like. Plus, a look at The Doctor's many traveling companions and adversaries over the years and how they all contribute to creating the longest running sci-fi show of all time. 


2013-11-21 - Special - An Adventure in Space and Time (Video:H264 720x404, 1480kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 95kbps)

This special one-off drama travels back in time to 1963 to see how Doctor Who was first brought to the screen. Actor William Hartnell felt trapped by a succession of hard-man roles. Wannabe producer Verity Lambert was frustrated by the TV industry's glass ceiling. Both of them were to find unlikely hope and unexpected challenges in the form of a Saturday tea-time drama. Allied with a team of unusual but brilliant people, they went on to create the longest running science fiction series ever made.


2013-11-23 - Special - 1. The Five(ish) Doctors Reboot (Video:H264 720x404, 1485kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 97kbps)

A star studded special written and directed by Peter Davison. With the 50th anniversary of Doctor Who about to film, the 'Classic' Doctors are keen to be involved. But do they manage it?


2013-11-23 - Special - 2. The Day of the Doctor (50th Anniversary Special) (Video:H264 1280x70, 1940kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 102kbps)

The Doctors embark on their greatest adventure in this 50th anniversary special. In 2013, something terrible is awakening in London's National Gallery; in 1562, a murderous plot is afoot in Elizabethan England; and somewhere in space an ancient battle reaches its devastating conclusion. All of reality is at stake as the Doctor's own dangerous past comes back to haunt him.


2013-11-23 - Special - 3.  The After Party (Video:H264 720x404, 1483kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 110kbps)

Zoe Ball and Rick Edwards are live, getting the party started for the ultimate celebration of 50 years of Doctor Who. With an impressive guest list of Doctors and companions both past and present, celebrity fans and some very special surprises, this is the after party not to be missed. As well as all the gossip on the new episode The Day of the Doctor, there are exclusive interviews, showstopping monster moments and plenty of fun. So make a date to celebrate with us and be a part of this time-traveling extravaganza as we say Happy Birthday Doctor Who.
